text: Until one has loved an animal a part of one's soul remains unawakened.
author: Anatole France

text: I'd say the best is when I was in Africa, I saw a hippo in a house. Someone had a pet hippo. And they're meant to be one of the most dangerous animals on the planet, and they had one that was sort of just wandering in and out of their house, just sort of roaming about.
author: Karl Pilkington

text: I heard that Jesus had a pet dinosaur. Evolution must be a myth then.
author: John Bacon

text: Many cats are the death of the mouse.
author: Kaspar Hauser

text: Dogs are my favorite people.
author: Richard Dean Anderson

text: Kittens are wide-eyed, soft and sweet. With needles in their jaws and feet.
author: Pam Brown

text: Those who wish to pet and baby wild animals 'love' them. But those who respect their natures and wish to let them live normal lives, love them more.
author: Edwin Way Teale

text: The smallest feline is a masterpiece.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: And I strongly believe people should rescue dogs, or, at the very least, listen to Bob Barker and have your pet spayed or neutered.
author: Justin Chambers

text: I used to have this little mouse. I buy birds from the pet store and I let them go.
author: Ziggy Marley

text: A hungry dog hunts best. A hungrier dog hunts even better.
author: Norman Ralph Augustine

text: To me, a cat is an easy pet, they don't need any spoiling or looking after.
author: Karl Pilkington

text: I used to love dogs until I discovered cats.
author: Nafisa Joseph

text: I have this pet thing about how global communications are moving so fast now, throwing information at you, making everything available to you, and yet I feel it's leaving us more and more isolated.
author: Mike Rutherford

text: Like all pure creatures, cats are practical.
author: William S. Burroughs

text: When you want a break from dogs, and you take them to the kennel to the stars, no one thinks you're a bad pet owner. But when you have kids, you can't drop them off for three weeks without someone calling Child Protective Services!
author: Gabrielle Union

text: A happy arrangement: many people prefer cats to other people, and many cats prefer people to other cats.
author: Mason Cooley

text: There are things that I invented - the creaky geriatric robot that is always grumpy, for example, or the little wheelie guy, he's not in the Hasbro lore. But kids love that stuff - this little guy as a pet on a chain. They gravitate towards it.
author: Michael Bay

text: I'm looking more like my dogs every day - it must be the shaggy fringe and the ears.
author: Christine McVie

text: A dog teaches a boy fidelity, perseverance, and to turn around three times before lying down.
author: Robert Benchley

text: I had a big Akita, Yoshi, who was fabulous. I loved him. We lost him when he was 12, and I've never been able to replace him. Normally, most people lose a pet and get another and keep going on. But it just felt wrong to me it felt disloyal.
author: Robert Crais

text: Pet me, touch me, love me, that's what I get when I perform. That's when I'm really getting what I want.
author: Connie Stevens

text: To this day I don't ever remember seeing a pet inside Moscow, I never saw anyone carrying a dog, or leading a dog. Err I finally saw a, a pet some years later in Kiev, so I thought that life must have been, different.
author: Ralph Boston

text: Crabbed and obscure definitions are of no use beyond a narrow circle of students, of whom probably every one has a pet one of his own.
author: Frederick Pollock

text: I am fond of pigs. Dogs look up to us. Cats look down on us. Pigs treat us as equals.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Cat: a pygmy lion who loves mice, hates dogs, and patronizes human beings.
author: Oliver Herford

text: We are telling veterans they must sacrifice to pay for the pet projects and contracts to campaign donors of powerful members of Congress.
author: Nick Lampson

text: My roommate got a pet elephant. Then it got lost. It's in the apartment somewhere.
author: Steven Wright

text: My parents used to take me to the pet department and tell me it was a zoo.
author: Billy Connolly

text: Even cats grow lonely and anxious.
author: Mason Cooley

text: Cats seem to go on the principle that it never does any harm to ask for what you want.
author: Joseph Wood Krutch

text: Kittens can happen to anyone.
author: Paul Gallico

text: Humans should always exercise and watch what they eat. So with your pet, make sure they get enough exercise, make sure they're getting fed at the same time every day and getting the nutrition they need. And make sure they get a lot of love and attention you both need. That's why you have them!
author: Alison Sweeney

text: I was in three academic clubs, a huge book worm and the teacher's pet. I was kind of an easy target for bullies.
author: Nicole Anderson

text: If cats were double the size they are now, they'd probably be illegal.
author: Doug Coupland

text: There are all sorts of cute puppy dogs, but it doesn't stop people from going out and buying Dobermans.
author: Angus Young

text: I have some road rage inside of me. Traffic, especially in L.A., is a pet peeve of mine.
author: Katie Holmes

text: One of my biggest pet peeves is that I just don't like it when characters do things that are funny to the writer, but you don't know why they're doing it and it doesn't make any sense.
author: Glenn Howerton

text: What counts is not necessarily the size of the dog in the fight - it's the size of the fight in the dog.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

text: Our cat is kind dove shellfish, and thinks the world is hers, She finds a comfy spot and then we pet turtle sheep purrs.
author: Brian P. Cleary

text: I always pet a dog with my left hand because if he bit me I'd still have my right hand to paint with.
author: Juan Gris

text: I poured spot remover on my dog. Now he's gone.
author: Steven Wright

text: I love animals and feel very strongly that people should not be allowed to buy a pet if they are not able to look after it.
author: Kirsty Gallacher

text: I had been told that the training procedure with cats was difficult. It's not. Mine had me trained in two days.
author: Bill Dana

text: If you have a deep-seated need to be loved and admired every day, you shouldn't be in politics. You should go work at a pet store.
author: Michael Nutter

text: I got a pet monkey called Charlie Chan.
author: Jimi Hendrix

text: If a dog jumps into your lap, it is because he is fond of you but if a cat does the same thing, it is because your lap is warmer.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

text: I could probably give you a list of a dozen pet peeves I have about my own physicality and why I couldn't get a second date.
author: Zachary Levi

text: Packing is my pet hate.
author: Seal

text: Pet stores just sell their animals.
author: Booboo Stewart

text: I kind of imagine myself at eighty, a cat lady.
author: Juliette Lewis

text: To his dog, every man is Napoleon hence the constant popularity of dogs.
author: Aldous Huxley

text: What a dog I got, his favorite bone is in my arm.
author: Rodney Dangerfield

text: Many who have spent a lifetime in it can tell us less of love than the child that lost a dog yesterday.
author: Thornton Wilder

text: No one can feel as helpless as the owner of a sick goldfish.
author: Kin Hubbard

text: Don't sweat the petty things and don't pet the sweaty things.
author: George Carlin

text: I have studied many philosophers and many cats. The wisdom of cats is infinitely superior.
author: Hippolyte Taine

text: I worked in a pet store and people would ask how big I would get.
author: Rodney Dangerfield

text: We all have our pet things that we like to get religious about.
author: Max Cannon

text: Cats have it all - admiration, an endless sleep, and company only when they want it.
author: Rod McKuen

text: I have felt cats rubbing their faces against mine and touching my cheek with claws carefully sheathed. These things, to me, are expressions of love.
author: James Herriot

text: It is impossible for a lover of cats to banish these alert, gentle, and discriminating friends, who give us just enough of their regard and complaisance to make us hunger for more.
author: Agnes Repplier

text: I've always been mad about cats.
author: Vivien Leigh

text: If you are a dog and your owner suggests that you wear a sweater suggest that he wear a tail.
author: Fran Lebowitz

text: Every time I decide I want a child I get another pet. I have 3 dogs, 13 birds and 3 horses, what does that tell you?
author: Alyssa Milano

text: I wonder if other dogs think poodles are members of a weird religious cult.
author: Rita Rudner

text: Just watching my cats can make me happy.
author: Paula Cole

text: There are people all over the world who like to write fan letters in the voice of their pet: 'Hello, my name is Fifi and I'm a labrador and I think you're great. Paw paw!'
author: Rebecca Hall

text: I've got a new invention. It's a revolving bowl for tired goldfish.
author: Lefty Gomez

text: A real Christian is a person who can give his pet parrot to the town gossip.
author: Billy Graham

text: Do not make the mistake of treating your dogs like humans or they will treat you like dogs.
author: Martha Scott

text: Only very brave mouse makes nest in cat's ear.
author: Earl Derr Biggers

text: The average dog is a nicer person than the average person.
author: Andy Rooney

text: I believe cats to be spirits come to earth. A cat, I am sure, could walk on a cloud without coming through.
author: Jules Verne

text: I try not to wear anything I have to fidget with - there's nothing worse than wearing something and pulling down the hem and re-adjusting the top. My pet hate is when girls wear those strapless dresses and spend the whole night yanking them up.
author: Sophie Ellis-Bextor

text: When a guy tells me I'm cute, it's not something desirable. Cute is more like what you want your pet to be.
author: Natalie Portman

text: There's a saying. If you want someone to love you forever, buy a dog, feed it and keep it around.
author: Dick Dale

text: I have a lot of plants and fish and a pet lizard and Venus flytraps. I have a whole ecosystem in my room, like a running waterfall and different lights and sensors set on digital timers.
author: Chris Pratt

text: There's kind of a toll you have to pay with a cat if you don't pet her for 10 minutes she'll bother you for six hours.
author: Scott Adams

text: Dogs are not our whole life, but they make our lives whole.
author: Roger Caras

text: Dachshunds are ideal dogs for small children, as they are already stretched and pulled to such a length that the child cannot do much harm one way or the other.
author: Robert Benchley

text: I was in New York and I walked into this pet store and came out with a dog.
author: Beverley Mitchell

text: Truth be told, ginormous portions have become a pet peeve of mine.
author: Hal Sparks

text: My parents were very permissive when it came to animals. As long as we earned the money to buy them and built whatever structure it was they were going to live in, we could have any kind of pet we wanted. They would have let us have a rhinoceros if we could have afforded it.
author: Maggie Stiefvater

text: A lover tries to stand in well with the pet dog of the house.
author: Moliere

text: We've begun to long for the pitter-patter of little feet - so we bought a dog. Well, it's cheaper, and you get more feet.
author: Rita Rudner

text: I have the same pet peeve as Anderson Cooper, which is bare feet in public. I hate it. It so grosses me out, especially in New York. Oh my God, New York in the summer with people and their feet in their sandals and their flip-flops, like get it away!
author: Busy Philipps

text: I have a pet lizard named Puff, five goldfish - named Pinky, Brain, Jowels, Pearl and Sandy, an oscar fish named Chef, two pacus, an albino African frog named Whitey, a bonsai tree, four Venus flytraps, a fruit fly farm and sea monkeys.
author: Chris Pratt

text: My pet peeve and my goal in life is to somehow get an adjective for 'integrity' in the dictionary. 'Truthful' doesn't really cover it, or 'genuine.' It should be like 'integritus.'
author: Rashida Jones

text: Cats are rather delicate creatures and they are subject to a good many different ailments, but I have never heard of one who suffered from insomnia.
author: Joseph Wood Krutch

text: I love cats.
author: Dick Van Patten

text: Time spent with cats is never wasted.
author: Sigmund Freud

text: I've been lucky. I've made films that I really like. It's been a combination of what comes to me and what I choose. I've gone after lots of things that I didn't get, pet projects that everybody ends up chasing after. Really, you're lucky if you get anything.
author: Hope Davis

text: No matter how much cats fight, there always seem to be plenty of kittens.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: I wish I could write as mysterious as a cat.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

text: Scratch a dog and you'll find a permanent job.
author: Franklin P. Jones

text: Cats are inquisitive, but hate to admit it.
author: Mason Cooley

text: Vinyl is the real deal. I've always felt like, until you buy the vinyl record, you don't really own the album. And it's not just me or a little pet thing or some kind of retro romantic thing from the past. It is still alive.
author: Jack White

text: Dogs laugh, but they laugh with their tails.
author: Max Eastman

text: Environmentalists hate sprawl - except when it comes to the size of their expansive pet legislation on Capitol Hill.
author: Michelle Malkin

text: Don't accept your dog's admiration as conclusive evidence that you are wonderful.
author: Ann Landers

text: People who keep dogs are cowards who haven't got the guts to bite people themselves.
author: August Strindberg

text: I have a Lab, it's fun to hang out and hike with the dog, people come up to him, and pet him, it's fun.
author: George Eads

text: I'm not about to go out and buy a snake for a pet. I mean, I may have faced a few fears but I'm not insane.
author: Kristin Davis

text: My biggest pet peeve are just girls who go to sports bars who have no intention on caring what teams are playing, like they're looking for just a night out. That drives me more crazy than anything else. Like, don't pretend to be a sports fan.
author: Jerry Ferrara

text: We have three cats. It's like having children, but there is no tuition involved.
author: Ron Reagan

text: You can get too bogged down in technology and you can sort of forget what it is you were trying to do. And with the Pet Shop Boys it's primarily about the songs, it's about song writing.
author: Chris Lowe

text: Never stand between a dog and the hydrant.
author: John Peers

text: I think there's something great and generic about goldfish. They're everybody's first pet.
author: Paul Rudd

text: Gypsy was the name my brother gave a pet turtle he had. I always thought it was so peculiar.
author: Joel Hodgson

text: No one appreciates the very special genius of your conversation as the dog does.
author: Christopher Morley

text: I am an enthusiast, but not a crank in the sense that I have some pet theories as to the proper construction of a flying machine. I wish to avail myself of all that is already known and then, if possible, add my mite to help on the future worker who will attain final success.
author: Wilbur Wright

text: The trees in Siberia are miles apart, that is why the dogs are so fast.
author: Bob Hope

text: It's true, you can never eat a pet you name. And anyway, it would be like a ventriloquist eating his dummy.
author: Alexander Theroux

text: Never wear anything that panics the cat.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

text: A kitten is in the animal world what a rosebud is in the garden.
author: Robert Southey

text: A kitten is chiefly remarkable for rushing about like mad at nothing whatever, and generally stopping before it gets there.
author: Agnes Repplier

text: We all know the stories about the Human Rights Act... about the illegal immigrant who cannot be deported because, and I am not making this up, he had a pet cat.
author: Theresa May

text: The government needs to help those in need, but members of Congress shouldn't take advantage of the situation and use a national tragedy as an opportunity to spend taxpayer dollars on their pet projects.
author: Chris Chocola

text: I've teamed up with PetSmart Charities to celebrate the five million homeless pets who've found homes through their in-store adoption centers, and to spread the word about how we can work together to save millions more pets' lives and, ultimately, end pet homelessness.
author: Josh Duhamel

text: Cats are connoisseurs of comfort.
author: James Herriot

text: The trouble with a kitten is that eventually it becomes a cat.
author: Ogden Nash

text: Pet lovers know that animals sometimes understand us better than we do, and the annals of human sin and desire provide plenty of stories to drive the point home.
author: Tony Snow

text: Animals are such agreeable friends - they ask no questions they pass no criticisms.
author: George Eliot

text: There's just me and my wife and a dog and we feed him Healthy Choice also.
author: Mike Ditka

text: There is no psychiatrist in the world like a puppy licking your face.
author: Bernard Williams

text: I don't have pet peeves I have whole kennels of irritation.
author: Whoopi Goldberg

text: I was a dog in a past life. Really. I'll be walking down the street and dogs will do a sort of double take. Like, Hey, I know him.
author: William H. Macy

text: Perhaps it is because cats do not live by human patterns, do not fit themselves into prescribed behavior, that they are so united to creative people.
author: Andre Norton

text: It doesn't work if the bad guys kill his mother's uncle's friend's neighbor's pet dog. You've got to make the stakes high.
author: Steven Seagal

text: It was so cold today that I saw a dog chasing a cat, and the dog was walking.
author: Mickey Rivers

text: My idea of a perfect pet is a really, really big dog! Huge!
author: Emily VanCamp

text: It is one of my pet hates when I see players who have agents who do everything for them. They don't know how to set up their own bank accounts, they don't know what they are spending their money on and they can't make their own decisions.
author: Gary Neville
